page.title: 14Montacute Today 29/6/85
page.content:
I have lived in Montacute all of my life and it has become my ultimate surroundings. Montacute is a well preserved village and is fairly quiet.This week is the carnival week and as one would expect everyone is rallying round to make the week as enjoyable as any other events throughout the year. On the Monday that has just past a special ceremony was held for the crowning of the carnival queen, in the shape of Marianne King, who had been selected by two judges after speaking to all the contestants. Wednesday brought a wheelbarrow race which anyone could enter. Darren Saint & I entered the younger section and as a result came first.
{MORE>
